meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ironic.
meanings.sent1: Her constant use of ironicalnesses in conversation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The book was full of unexpected ironicalnesses that kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent3: The irony in the situation added a touch of ironicalnesses to the otherwise serious discussion.
meanings.sent4: The ironicalnesses of fate never ceased to surprise him.
meanings.sent5: The film's plot twist was a masterful display of ironicalnesses.

meanings.sent1: The play was filled with cleverly crafted ironicalnesses that left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: In literature, one can find many examples of subtle ironicalnesses that convey deeper meanings.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected turn of events added a layer of ironicalnesses to the story.
meanings.sent4: The ironicalnesses of life often make us reflect on our own actions.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes were laced with sharp ironicalnesses that resonated with the crowd.
